headline: Audiio Hires CD Baby Sync Industry Veteran Brett Byrd To Lead TV/Film
summary: Audiio.com, a leading music licensing platform powering millions of creative projects worldwide, today announced the hiring of Brett Byrd as Director of Creative Licensing. A seasoned veteran of the sync licensing industry, Byrd brings over 10 years of experience securing high-profile placements for music in film, television, advertising, and branded content.

headline: Argus Upgrades Nike (NKE) on Signs of Recovery and Strong Outlook
summary: Nike, Inc. (NYSE:NKE) is one of the 12 best consumer goods stocks billionaires are quietly buying. On July 1, Argus upgraded Nike Inc. (NYSE: NKE) from Hold to Buy, setting a price target of $85 following a sharp 15.66% gain in the stock over the prior week. The upgrade reflects renewed optimism about Nike’s performance, […]

headline: Nike Expected $3 Million In Sales — Air Jordan Made $126 Million In Year One And Became A Global Icon
summary: Nike (NYSE:NKE) predicted Air Jordan would make only $3 million in sales over its first three to four years. Instead, the line brought in about $126 million in its first year. That breakout success vaulted NBA great Michael Jordan into retail legend and reshaped Nike's future. Jordan Brand now earns billions yearly, keeping the Jumpman logo central to modern sneaker culture. That journey started with one risky contract and a shoe the NBA tried to ban. Rookie Deal Reshapes Sneakers In October 198
